document.docAuthor: Filho, Fernando Da Silva Carvalho, Esposito, Maria Cristina & Santos, Rita De Cássia Oliveira Dos
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Helgreelia Gaimari (Diptera: Odiniidae) from Brazil, with a key to the Neotropical species of Odiniidae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Helgreelia Gaimari (Diptera: Odiniidae) from Brazil, with a key to the Neotropical species of Odiniidae

mods:name.mods:namePart: Santos, Rita De Cássia Oliveira Dos

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Neotropical species of Odiniidae (modified from
Shewell ( 1960 )
, Sabrosky ( 1969 ),
Prado ( 1973 )
and
Gaimari ( 2007 ))

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Posterior ocelli in front of line between medial vertical setae; ocelli usually arranged in isosceles triangle with posterior ocelli closely spaced; frons usually relatively arched and sometimes conspicuously tuberculate; scutellar disc sometimes setulose; in profile, face and frons more or less in line or sloping; TRAGINOPINAE ............................ 7

- Posterior ocelli in line with medial vertical setae; ocelli arranged in equilateral triangle or with distance between posterior pair greater than between either posterior ocelli more widely spaced; frons flat to slightly concave and never tuberculate; scutellar disc bare; in profile, face and frons meeting at a angle; ODINIINAE ,
Odinia
Robineau- Desvoidy ....................................................................................................................................................................... 2
- Wing with numerous black spots, most of them surrounded by a whitish corona ..................................................... 4

3 . Cell R 1 with two transverse black spots...................
Odinia biguttata Sabrosky
( Virgin Islands , Puerto Rico , USA )

4 . Oral vibrissa and one or two subvibrissal setae distinctly flattened ....
Odinia williamsi Johnson (Galápagos Islands)
- Oral vibrissa and subvibrissal setae slender, not unusually broadly flattened.............................................................. 5

5 . Antennal segments almost entirely yellow ................
Odinia parvipunctata Sabrosky
( Virgin Islands , Puerto Rico )

6 . Anepisternum gray with brown stripe ventrally; cell cua 1 with one small and one large brown spots, large one tran- versing cell, beginning in vein CuA 1 and ending in wing ventral margin ...............
Odinia surumuana Prado
( Brazil )

- Anepisternum gray with brown stripe dorsally; cell cua 1 with two very small brown spots, close to vein CuA 1 ......... ..............................................................................................
Odinia coronata Sabrosky
( USA , El Salvador , Panama )

8 . Arista long-plumose; vein M 1 strongly curved forward at apex .....................................
Paratraginops Hendel
….. 9

- Arista pubescent; vein M 1 straight ................
Neotraginops clathratus (Hendel)
( Peru , Paraguay , Brazil , Colombia )

9 . Base of scutellum thickly haired. Anterior four fronto-orbital setae not set in fuscous spots........................................
.......................................................................................................... Paratraginops pilicornis
Cress ( Guyana , Brazil )

11 . Scutellum at most bearing 2–3 setulae along margin .........................................................
Lopesiodinia Prado
..... 12

12 . Arista pubescent; front little narrowed posteriorly ..............................................
Lopesiodinia diversa Prado
( Brazil )

- Arista with long rays; front very narrowed posteriorly ................................
Lopesiodinia alvarengai Prado
( Brazil )

13 . Only anterior fronto-orbital seta inclinate ........................................................................
Schildomyia Malloch
…. 14

- Several anterior fronto-orbital setae inclinate..........................................
Neoschildomyia fusca Gaimari
( Costa Rica )

- Clipeo without velvet brown spot...........................................
Schildomyia vittithorax Malloch
( Costa Rica , Panama )

17 . Lunule with a large velvet black spot ....................................................
Schildomyia trinidadensis Hennig
( Trinidad )

- Lunule without a large velvet black spot ..........................................................
Schildomyia peruviana Hennig
( Peru )
- Scutellum grayish pruinose, with light-brown spots in many parts of scutellum, forming patterns ......................... 19

20 . Thorax with spots scattered, not forming patterns. Abdomen light-brown. Male fifth tergite reticulate ......................
........................................................................................................................... Schildomyia reticulata
Prado ( Brazil )
- Abdomen black. Thorax with spots arranged in line. Male fifth tergite normal ...................................................... 21

21 . Lunule with a velvet black spot; basoflagellomere yellow, without black spots ..
Schildomyia goyana Prado
( Brazil )

- Lunule without a velvet black spot; basoflagellomere with black spot on inner and outer surface ...............................
............................................................................................................. Schildomyia punctifrons
Malloch ( Costa Rica )
- Postocellar setae absent; posterior part of head concave from dorsal view ............................................................... 23

23 . Several anterior fronto-orbital setae inclinate; scutellar disc setulose................
Shewellia agromyzina Hennig
( Peru )

- With single inclinate fronto-orbital seta; scutellar disc bare ..............................................
Helgreelia Gaimari
…. 24

24 . Abdomen orange, with fine pale setulae.........................................................
Helgreelia albeto Gaimari
( Costa Rica )

- Abdominal tergites mostly brown with posterior margin yellow; arista plumose on the basal half ............................. ............................................................................................................................
Helgreelia gaimarii
sp. nov.
( Brazil )
